result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:47 AM Defendant Brandon L Smith in court.  Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for Brandon L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for Plea hearing.
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Case dismissed and read in to 21CM2049.
Cash bail to be transferred to 21CM2049 pending sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Compliance Report dated October 12, 2022

9/29/22:  Court modifies the conditions of bond from no contact with Victim A to no violent contact with Victim A.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to comply with all conditions in Waukesha County Case: 21CM2049.  Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring.  CAM monitor shall not be removed until further order of the Trial Court only.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

10:07 AM Defendant Brandon L Smith in court.  Attorney Bryant J Mcfadden in court for Brandon L Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court addresses motion to modify bond in 22CM1564..
Arguments by the Defense.

For the reasons stated on the record the Court grants the motion to modify the bond to include no violent contact with Victim A.
This matter to tag along with 21CM2049 for further scheduling.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on September 2, 2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to comply with all conditions in Waukesha County Case: 21CM2049.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring.  CAM monitor shall not be removed until further order of the Trial Court only.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

2:38 PM Defendant Brandon L Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Brandon L Smith. Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  Attorney Wang notates that Attorney Bryant McFadden is currently Court appointed on defendants other matter, case 21CM2049.  The Court extends the appointment of Attorney Bryant McFadden to this case.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.   The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will immediately issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
